task_summary: Robot arm locates, approaches, and grasps the red apple lying on the table using a top grasp pattern, as exemplified over nine sequential frames of the contact sheet.

task_long_description.overview: This task involves a robotic manipulator identifying and picking up a red apple placed on a small table in a kitchen-like environment. The scene features three fruits (red apple, green apple, orange) and various obstacles nearby, which the robot must navigate and avoid. The robot uses visual perception to detect and verify the target object before performing a precise top-down grasp. Phases proceed from perception to approach, grasp, and grasp verification, with sequential checks built for robustness.
preconditions: Workspace visually clear enough for detection
Red apple present and unobstructed on the table
Gripper functional and able to open/close
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of red apple, retry scanning if required
Move above the red apple with appropriate offset
Approach and align with low tolerance
success_criteria: Gripper moves into correct pregrasp pose
Red apple securely grasped with a top grasp
Object detected inside gripper after grasp
failure_and_recovery: Red apple not initially visible: retry scan up to 3 attempts
Grasp fails: re-attempt if object not in gripper
Detection noise: verify with explicit detection after scan
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after apple is in gripper and grasp pose is stable

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks whether the red apple is within view
Performs a raster scan to locate the red apple if not yet visible
Runs detection to confirm position of the red apple
Opens the gripper in preparation for grasp
Moves the end-effector to a position above the red apple
Computes the optimal grasp pose using a top grasp strategy
Robot approaches and aligns with the apple within tight tolerance
Executes the grasp maneuver at the computed pose using the top strategy
Checks if the red apple is present in the gripper after the grasp

failure_modes: apple occluded by other objects or table edge
wrong object detected or localization drift
gripper fails to open or close
top grasp strategy unable to secure apple
recovery_strategy: repeat open/close cycle if gripper not functioning
assumptions: Frames [0-8] support apple is accessible, visible, and graspable from top
Instruction specifies red apple, which matches physical evidence
No explicit force or speed constraints inferred from frames or instruction

expected_success_criteria: Red apple in gripper after top grasp
